content.description: Climb varied cracks on excellent rock.
content.location: Near the left end of the wall on o right of Sunshine Arete and below the huge juniper. Approach from the left end of the cliff or rap in from the tree.

content.description: Climb varied cracks past a couple of small roofs.
content.location: Toward the right end of the wall( about 50ft right of "GB") is a 10inch pine on the rim. Rap here, the route goes up the right hand weakness.

content.description: Boulder up to a good ledge then blast up steep big hands crack to a short slab then fly up steep juggy crack to a corner.
content.location: Toward the right end of the wall is a group of oak trees. rap fixed line or 4thclass down to shared anchor with "Glitter Balls".The crack is right of GB and 10ft left of the big roof with ominous block (seems to be pretty solid as we tried to trundle it!)

content.description: Climb varied steepening cracks on the left side of the arete. Near the top step right and enjoy the exposure.
content.protection: double set of finger sized then single set to #4, a few nuts.
content.location: Sunshine Arete is below a huge juniper near the left end of the cliff. It is the first part of the wall to see any sun (mid-morning or later). walk to the base from the left end of the cliff or rap in from the tree.

content.description: climb varied cracks up steep wall
content.location: Toward the right end of the wall( about 50ft right of "GB") is a 10inch pine on the rim. Rap here, the route goes up the left hand weakness.

content.description: This route is pretty nuts! A mixed route sports several cruxes and is of full value! Sporty start up bolted face. When it slabs out run for a diagonal crack then step high for a mantle, take care with your glitter balls! Rest up, then up the tips crack to another short corner. Finally, a careful step right (remember to protect your follower) to the final finger crack and the anchor.
content.protection: 3 bolts, double set from tiny to #1, single  #2, #3. bring at least 3 long runners.
content.location: Toward the right end of the wall, at it's tallest point. There is a group of oak trees on the rim: rap fixed line or 4th class down 12ft to the bolted anchor.

content.description: Mostly North facing so is a good summer or fringe season area. This is the basalt cliff visible across Pumphouse Wash from Oak Creek Overlook. 6 routes established as of 10/2021 with room for plenty more!
